lead_paragraph: Roger Hoit gave up playing tennis and turned to golf after graduating from Amherst. That decision finally paid off for the 46-year-old Hoit as he won the Ike Stroke Play Championship at the Fresh Meadow Club in Great Neck, N.Y. Hoit, who posted rounds of 75 and 74, finished at 218. Andrew Giuliani, the defending titlist and the first-round leader, and Joe Saladino wound up tied for second at 220. Hoit birdied the par-4 17th hole and followed with another par 4 that clinched his victory.
